src:
Fan Diminta Tak Sambut Taeyang dan Daesung BIGBANG usai Wamil
04 Nov 2019, 18:52 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Taeyang dan Daesung dijadwalkan menuntaskan masa wajib militer pada Minggu (10/11) mendatang. (dok. YG Entertainment via Facebook)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- YG Entertainment akhirnya memberikan kabar terbaru mengenai penyelesaian masa wajib militer Taeyang dan Daesung BIGBANG yang hanya tinggal hitungan hari. Keduanya diketahui akan menyelesaikan masa wajib militernya pada tanggal 10 November mendatang. Dalam pernyataan resmi, YG meminta agar para penggemar tidak datang ke lokasi pelepasan tugas dari kedua member BIGBANG tersebut. "Berdasarkan Kementerian Pertahanan Nasional, Taeyang dan Daesung akan menyelesaikan tugasnya pada 10 November di Komando Operasi Darat di Yongin, Provinsi Gyeonggi," demikian pernyataan agensi, Senin (4/11)."Pangkalan militer di mana keduanya melayani sama-sama berada di wilayah perbatasan, di mana virus Demam Babi Afrika (ASF) telah terdeteksi dan berada di area kontrol pusat, sehingga perwakilan dari militer telah menjelaskan bahwa lokasi pelepasan mereka telah diubah karena penggemar dan wartawan diperkirakan akan berkunjung," YG melanjutkan.Selain itu agensi mengatakan bahwa lahan parkir yang terbatas akan mempersulit penggemar dan wartawan datang ke lokasi tersebut.


Daesung dan Taeyang bakal menyelesaikan masa wajib militer bersamaan, yakni pada Minggu (10/11) mendatang. (dok. YG Entertainment)

YG Entertainment meminta para V.I.P, sebutan bagi fan BIGBANG, untuk memahami hal ini dan mau bekerja sama. Agensi menyampaikan rasa terima kasih terhadap penggemar yang sudah setia menunggu kembalinya kedua anggota tersebut dari masa wajib militer. Taeyang dan Daesung masuk bersamaan pada bulan Maret 2018 lalu dan dijadwalkan untuk selesai pada bulan November ini. Sebelumnya, leader dari BIGBANG, G-Dragon telah terlebih dahulu menyelesaikan masa tugasnya. Ia bebas dari wajib militer pada 26 Oktober lalu. Pada saat pelepasannya, YG Entertainment juga sempat meminta para V.I.P untuk tidak datang ke lokasi karena alasan yang sama. (kir/rea)
text:
Fan Asked Not To Welcome Taeyang and Daesung BIGBANG after the Army
Nov 04 2019, 18:52 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Taeyang and Daesung are scheduled to complete their mandatory military service on Sunday (10/11). (doc. YG Entertainment via Facebook)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - YG Entertainment finally gave the latest news regarding the completion of Taeyang and Daesung BIGBANG's military service which only took a matter of days. Both are known to complete their mandatory military service on 10 November. In an official statement, YG requested that fans not come to the location of the relinquishment of the two BIGBANG members. "Based on the Ministry of National Defense, Taeyang and Daesung will complete their duties on November 10 at the Army Operations Command in Yongin, Gyeonggi Province," the agency statement said Monday (4/11). "The military bases where they both serve are in the region. border, where the African Pig Fever (ASF) virus has been detected and is in the central control area, so representatives from the military have explained that the location of their release has been changed because fans and reporters are expected to visit, "YG continued. In addition the agency said that the land limited parking will make it difficult for fans and reporters to come to the location.


Daesung and Taeyang will complete the period of conscription together, namely on Sunday (11/10). (doc. YG Entertainment)

YG Entertainment asked the V.I.P, as BIGBANG fans, to understand this and want to work together. The agency expressed its gratitude to the fans who had been faithfully awaiting the return of the two members from military service. Taeyang and Daesung entered together in March 2018 and are scheduled to finish this November. Previously, the leader of BIGBANG, G-Dragon had already completed his tenure. He was released from military service on 26 October. At the time of their release, YG Entertainment also briefly asked the V.I.P not to come to the location for the same reason. (kir / rea)
